fields.headline: Michael Holden's All ears
fields.bodyText: By some unfeasible oversight, I took my seat at a cinema even before the commercials had begun. Equally surprising was the fact that there were other people already there, talking and so on. Man 1 "I was there, watching Pixie Lott in the rain, and I just thought, 'I've had enough'. Am I too old for this shit? Shivering in a tent." Woman "Ha!" Man 1 "But it was good, you know? A really good festival, very well run. How's things going with you?" Woman "OK." Man 1 (like he knew she had a secret) "I hear you've got a new settee." Woman (with a jokey confessional face) "On Saturday, I just stayed in." Man 1 (sincerely) "Awesome!" Man 2 (sitting down beside them, laden with snacks) "How are you, then?" Man 1 "Bit buggy, went to a festival, got wet. Now got consumption or something!" Man 2 "Which festival?" Man 1 (genuinely struggling with his recent past) "Isle of … is it, Isle of Wight?" Man 2 "Yeah. Isle of Wight. How was that? " Man 1 "It was very well run." Man 2 "Yeah, that's what I hear, but, I mean, who was playing? Who was good?" Man 1 "Joan Jett, who for me was the highlight." Man 2 "That's my era!" Man 1 "You been anywhere?" Man 2 (clenching and raising his fist) "Yeah, on holiday to Greece … White Riot!" And with that light-hearted revolutionary gesture, the adverts began.
